intro: Apatostelis braccata, commonly known as the bracted pterostigma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive bracts that are often brightly colored and serve as an attraction for pollinators. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with showy bracts that can resemble petals. The botanical features of Apatostelis braccata make it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
